addDisplay(java.lang.String).name: addDisplay(java.lang.String)

changeDisplay(int,java.lang.String).name: changeDisplay(int,java.lang.String)
changeDisplay(int,java.lang.String).documentation:
Changes properties of a simulated display. If {@param qualifiersStr} starts with a plus ('+') sign, the display's previous configuration is modified with the given qualifiers; otherwise defaults are applied as described here.

Idles the main looper to ensure all listeners are notified. @param displayId the display id to change @param qualifiersStr the {@link Qualifiers} string representing characteristics of the new display

changeDisplay(int,org.robolectric.util.C.name: changeDisplay(int,org.robolectric.util.Consumer<org.robolectric.android.internal.DisplayConfig>)

getSaturationLevel().name: getSaturationLevel()
getSaturationLevel().documentation:
Returns the current display saturation level set via {@link
android.hardware.display.DisplayManager#setSaturationLevel(float)}.

removeDisplay(int).name: removeDisplay(int)
removeDisplay(int).documentation:
Removes a simulated display and idles the main looper to ensure all listeners are notified.

@param displayId the display id to remove

setDefaultBrightnessConfiguration(java.l.name: setDefaultBrightnessConfiguration(java.lang.Object)

setSaturationLevel(float).name: setSaturationLevel(float)
setSaturationLevel(float).documentation:
Sets the current display saturation level.

This is a workaround for tests which cannot use the relevant hidden
{@link android.annotation.SystemApi},
{@link android.hardware.display.DisplayManager#setSaturationLevel(float)}.

name: org.robolectric.shadows.ShadowDisplayManager
documentation:
For tests, display properties may be changed and devices may be added or removed
programmatically.
